title: S3rvant
body:
It's been a while since I posted here, but I have some news! While looking into how I could store data retrieved from APIs with usage limits (e.g. YouTube), I concluded that some sort of server-side storage was unavoidable.

This is problematic as NoOp is a serverless website. One of the many reasons it was created was to experiment with statically hosted websites, something I am not going to change just for storage. You see, server-side storage requires server-side integration.

So, with static hosting in mind, I turned to S3. Also, off the back of writing Guardian , I wanted to try out my new parameter validation library. Therefore, I set to work on a project for simplifying communication with S3. My intention is to maybe put it in a lambda one day. Server-side code without the servers. Anyways, one step at a time.

For now, here it is;

S3rvant - on GitHub
